title: David Silva poses for photo with Manchester City's three trophies alongside his grandparents and son
text:
David Silva returned home to Gran Canaria with all three of Manchester City's trophies from last season and took one of the greatest family photos you'll ever see.

The midfielder posed with the shiny silverware alongside his grandparents and his son to put every Sunday league 'most improved player' to shame - and posted the image to social media with the caption 'The street where it all started'.

Silva, 33, is sitting on a bench with the Premier League, FA Cup and Carabao Cup trophies and son, Mateo Silva, on his lap.

David Silva poses with Manchester City's three trophies alongside his family in Gran Canaria

The Spaniard has won nine major trophies with Manchester City including four league titles

The photo was well received by Manchester City fans on Twitter, who showed their appreciation towards Silva.

One fan replied: 'That's one of the tweets I've ever seen! Legend not a strong enough word for El Mago'.

Others replied to Silva's photo with, 'What a truly lovely picture legend' and 'Beautiful family photo'.

The Manchester City star has had some tough, family related matters in recent times after his son was born prematurely by five months back in 2018.

His son's condition saw the Spaniard take some time away from football to be with his family and he received overwhelming support from his club, their fans and the footballing world - a factor that makes this photo all the more sweeter and poignant.

The central midfielder has got some time off during the International break after retiring from Spain last year. He will return to Manchester soon as City prepare to bounce back in the Premier League from their shock 2-0 defeat to Wolves.
description: The midfielder posed for a photo with his grandparents and son in his hometown of Gran Canaria. It posted to social media with the caption 'The street where it all started'.
